item.title: By: Daniel Schultz
item.dc:creator: Daniel Schultz
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/10/introducing-opened-captions/#comment-256">Nick Poulos</a>.
It's up now! Sorry for not mentioning sooner -- and the uptime is now better... should last for a while now
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nick Poulos.

It’s up now! Sorry for not mentioning sooner — and the uptime is now better… should last for a while now

item.title: By: Dan
item.dc:creator: Dan
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/10/introducing-opened-captions/#comment-256">Nick Poulos</a>.
You are correct! I unfortunately ended up deciding to stop paying for cable (I was subscribed only for Opened Captions) because I wasn't able to get any support for the project. I'm still looking for ways to get the stream back up; if you know any organizations interested in hosting a copy of the tool I would love to turn it on again!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nick Poulos.

You are correct! I unfortunately ended up deciding to stop paying for cable (I was subscribed only for Opened Captions) because I wasn’t able to get any support for the project. I’m still looking for ways to get the stream back up; if you know any organizations interested in hosting a copy of the tool I would love to turn it on again!

item.title: By: Nick Poulos
item.dc:creator: Nick Poulos
item.description: it seems the demo is down? I am getting a bad gateway error at http://openedcaptions.com/
item.content:encoded: it seems the demo is down? I am getting a bad gateway error at http://openedcaptions.com/

item.title: By: Henry Foulds
item.dc:creator: Henry Foulds
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/10/introducing-opened-captions/#comment-254">Herve</a>.
I don't mean that. What I mean is provide a way for a captioner who is captioning an event, no a TV broadcast, to send their text over the internet so it can be viewed on an Opened Captions website.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Herve.

I don’t mean that. What I mean is provide a way for a captioner who is captioning an event, no a TV broadcast, to send their text over the internet so it can be viewed on an Opened Captions website.

item.title: By: Herve
item.dc:creator: Herve
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2012/10/introducing-opened-captions/#comment-252">Henry Foulds</a>.
If I understand well, you would propose to involve the whole community in doing closed caption? that would be great ! (even if that would probably generate a lot of mess)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Henry Foulds.

If I understand well, you would propose to involve the whole community in doing closed caption? that would be great ! (even if that would probably generate a lot of mess)

item.title: By: Herve
item.dc:creator: Herve
item.description:
Hi,
it looks like a very interesting tool/library. However I am new in that field and there are various things that I do not understand. I downloaded open-cations and installed it locally. It works directly, out of the box! Great! I can launch the server using the command >>node app, and then I can visualize the page on localhost:3000.
However, what I don't understand is how to connect this server with a tv+caption stream. Eg, how to connect it with C-SPAN. More specifically, to get all the closed captions info from that channel.
Other questions, do you know other channels that I can get with your tools? For example, I am interested with european channels. Would it works? (perhaps I should have first a special box?) Any ideas? hints?
Thank you for your help and happy new year, Herve.
item.content:encoded:
Hi,

it looks like a very interesting tool/library. However I am new in that field and there are various things that I do not understand. I downloaded open-cations and installed it locally. It works directly, out of the box! Great! I can launch the server using the command >>node app, and then I can visualize the page on localhost:3000.

However, what I don’t understand is how to connect this server with a tv+caption stream. Eg, how to connect it with C-SPAN. More specifically, to get all the closed captions info from that channel.

Other questions, do you know other channels that I can get with your tools? For example, I am interested with european channels. Would it works? (perhaps I should have first a special box?)
Any ideas? hints?

Thank you for your help and happy new year,
Herve.

item.title: By: Henry Foulds
item.dc:creator: Henry Foulds
item.description: This is an awesome idea. It'd be great if you could have a captioner producing their own captions in an Opened Captions console, and they can be picked up on the website. I'm a captioner, and I would pay to use it.
item.content:encoded: This is an awesome idea. It’d be great if you could have a captioner producing their own captions in an Opened Captions console, and they can be picked up on the website. I’m a captioner, and I would pay to use it.
